text: Also, in my career and I think in general in careers that are people related, skills that are really helpful to develop (we also have them naturally but they might need some more shine :star: that comes with experience even just when dealing with others) :                                                                                                                            -Active Listening (to be able to really listen to someone with curiosity about what they have to say and not just to listen and thinking what to reply, with active listening people really feel valued and heard..)                                                                                                                                                                                                            -Empathy (to be able to relate to someone's feelings even if we haven't felt exactly the same and try to understand where they are coming from without judgement..)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                -Care (to genuinely care about the other person and give them our time which is the most valuable thing someone can give as people are feeling important)                -Communication & Reflect (to be able to communicate our ideas clearly and reflect back to people what they are saying with our own words, again it helps us understand more and they feel heard)
oh no this didn't come out as I wrote it! hehehe wait I'll fix it
I will write it again here

Also, in my career and I think in general in careers that are people related, skills that are really helpful to develop (we also have them naturally but they might need some more shine :star: that comes with experience even just when dealing with others) :

-Active Listening (to be able to really listen to someone with curiosity about what they have to say and not just to listen and thinking what to reply, with active listening people really feel valued and heard..)
-Empathy (to be able to relate to someone's feelings even if we haven't felt exactly the same and try to understand where they are coming from without judgement..)
-Care (to genuinely care about the other person and give them our time which is the most valuable thing someone can give as people are feeling important)
-Communication & Reflect (to be able to communicate our ideas clearly and reflect back to people what they are saying with our own words, again it helps us understand more and they feel heard)

I thought that maybe I will summarise what I have found to be of value when working with people in such fields and thought you will find some of these in yourself already and maybe use them up in your statement or in general as information :relaxed:

Yeah i was planning to perfect my personal statement over these holidays! I’ve definitely considered moving out for uni now, it will most likely happen and i’m nervous and excited at the same time:grin: thank you so much for that i will definitely use that in my personal statement, as most of the skills i feel like i already have and can improve even more!

So since you studied psychology in uni as well, do you mind explaning to me what modules they teach you? Also what was your favourite module(topic)?Also:joy: as well as exams is there a ton of coursework involved in this subject?
Another question, how did you manage all your notes in lectures? Like did you take a laptop to the lectures or a notebook? Which one do you think is more efficient?
